Here are some of my favorite resources

## Books

Here are some of my favorite books

| Title | Author | Tag | Note
| --- | --- | --- | -- |
| [The Design of Everyday Things](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/840.The_Design_of_Everyday_Things) | Donald A. Norman | Design | As applicable to programming as it is to the design of toilets|
| [The First 90 Days](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15824358-the-first-90-days?ref=nav_sb_ss_1_17) | Michael D. Watkins | Management | A great resource for anyone starting a new job - recommended by [Lura Long](https://www.linkedin.com/in/luralong/)|
| [The Checklist Manifesto]() | Atul Gawande |Medicine | Gawande is one of my favorite writers at the intersection of science and medicine. |
| [How big things get done](https://www.goodreads.com/en/book/show/61327449) | Bent Flyvbjerg, Dan Gardner | Project Management| Should be required reading for anyone working on projects with teams - recommended by [Nicole Mirea](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nimirea/)|
| [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/) | Hadley Wickham, Garrett Grolemund | R | A great resource for learning R |
| [Writing R Packages](https://r-pkgs.org/) | Hadley Wickham | R | The bible of R package development|
| [It](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/830502.It) | Stephen King | Fiction | I just wish they would print it in two separate volumes  |
